juzs.text: what now are they asking about
is it the great news of resurrection
the subject of dispute between those who argue in favour and those who argue against it
No, but they shall soon come to know
No, but indeed they shall soon come to know. Then Allah reminds them by drawing their attention to His omnipotence; He says
Did We not prepare the earth to be a settled habitation
and the mountains as stays that afford stabilization
We created you in pairs
We made your sleep* a repose for relief and recuperation
and the night a vestment and black was the colour chosen to absorb all light emanating from the cosmic sources of illumination
We made the day-time luminous for activity and livelihood
We built above you seven fortitudinous heavens vast and with endless amplitude
We installed a lamp glowing dispensing heat and illumination
We sent down from the rainy clouds water affluent and at times involving succession
To bring forth therewith grains and vegetation
and thickly foliaged orchards and gardens of delightful variation
Indeed the Day of Judgment foreordained falls at an absolute time Predestinated
This is the Day the trumpet is sounded and you come together in throngs embodying your souls and fully actuated
and the heaven is opened typifying open doors for the adminission of all
and the mountains are set in motion and into a mirage as if transmigrated
There and then hell is made to lie in wait
It is the destined abode of the transgressors wherein they are designated
Therein, they remain for ages as has been predestinated
They will taste no coolness for relief nor a drink to quench their thirst
But only boiling water and their rotten discharges for doing their worst
A requital commensurate with deeds
They never believed they would be judged
and Our revelations and signs they charged with falsehood and insolently did they negate
But everything We kept on record and in a book did We incorporate
Now taste the outcome of your deeds and plenty of the same will We increase and perpetuate
But for the righteous there is victory in the attainment of their goal
Orchards and vineyards
Companions of like age featuring highest quality of attractive femininity
and a cup full of delightful drink, clear, pure and really good
No vanities shall they hear therein nor is it the place for falsehood, or discord
A recompense from Allah, your Creator and a reward greatly in accord
Creator of the heavens and the earth and all in between. AL- Rahman, with whom no one can hold discourse nor shall an argument be allowed to intervene
This is the day when the spirit Jibril (Gabriel) and the angels stand in lines and keep silence at its height, except he whom AL-Rahman permits and then he says what is right
Indeed this is the day of truth, and who so desires may still turn to Allah, his Creator, for tutelary protection

We have warned you of punishment evident and quite near that deserves attention. On the day it comes to pass shall every one look at his deeds, the lawful and the lawless which his wrongful and unclean hands had committed. The infidel shall wish, then, he had remained mere dust
By the angels who violently disembody the souls of those who die captivated by disbelief and discord
and by the angels who tenderly disembody the souls of those who are with Allah in accord
and by the angels who convey an act of Allah's mercy, vouchsafed to His creatures
Then they press forward competing to be foremost
Then they execute the Allah's commands, and conduct the affairs
The day shall come when the trumpet is sounded and the universe goes into a violent convulsion
To be followed by the second sound when all shall go in extreme commotion
All hearts are then in extreme agitation
All eyes are cast down in humble modesty and utter humiliation
Yet people in their doubt, wonder whether after interment they could be restored to their former state
They cannot perceive how! "when bones disintegrate
Should this be true", they say, "it will mean immeasurable loss and condign punishment
Indeed all it takes is only one single rallying cry
and there they declare themselves on the surface of the earth
Have you heard O Muhammad of the narrative of Mussa
When Allah, his Creator, called him while he was in the sacred valley of Tuwa
Go to Pharaoh", Allah said, "for he has gone beyond all limits and all bounds he transgressed
Say to him: "Would you like to follow a path that leads you to righteousness and purity
I will guide you to the path of Allah your Creator, and thus you will find your innermost thoughts and being have become sensible of Him and your secret feelings will urge you to pay your duty to Him
Then Mussa, showed him the great act featuring Allah's Omnipotence and Authority
But Pharaoh refused to admit the truth and favoured disobedience
He turned his back to contend the truth with falsehood
He thronged the place with an audience and made a proclamation to satisfy his day dream
He said: "I am your lord supreme
But Allah punished him in requital as a caution against further transgression and made of him an example in this world, and worse shall his punishment be in Day of Judgement and adjudication
Indeed, in this event there is an instructive example to those who fear Allah and dread His indignation
Are you people the more difficult to create, or the heaven which He constructed
He lifted it up so high and its vast dimensions did He perfect and with celestial bodies did He complete it and its realms did He actuate
Its night did He darken and the day did He pervade with light and illuminate
and the earth did He prepare for life at a later date
He exteriorized its water and out of it did He spring its vegetation
and the mountains He set and anchored for stabilization
All being instrumental in supplying provisions for you and for your cattle
Then when the calamitous eventful event comes to pass
Man will then remember all he did
and Hell is brought in view for all to see
Then he who had transgressed
and chose to give himself to the life of this world and its vanities
Hell, for him, is the abode
But he who feared the moment of audience of his Creator and endeavoured to make his pious principles and his words together accord, and restrained himself from vanities and discord
Paradise, for him, is certainly the abode
They ask you O Muhammad as to when is the time of this proclaimed Hour
But how could you satisfy their query when you yourself do not know
It is only with Allah your Creator, that the knowledge of the appointed time rests
You are only there as a spectacle and a warning to him who fears it and on the wings of righteousness he rode sublime
On the day they eye-witness the Event, it appears to them in retrospect as if it were only an afternoon or a forenoon that they actually spent
He, -the Messenger- frowned and turned away
When the blind man came in (and interrupted his exhortation to some of the Qurashite nobilities who tried to suppress his mission and stood in his way)
You Muhammad do not know; he -the blind man- may well hug faith to his innermost thoughts and to his innermost being and commend his secret feelings to Allah
Or he might ponder what he learns and profit by it
But he who is rich, with abundant means at command
You give him attention, hoping he would submit
Yet you are absolved if his disbelief in Allah does not remit
But he who comes to you seeking authoritative counsel and admonition
With heart full of reverence and mindful of submission
you are unmindful of him and you give him little attention
No indeed, but let this incident be an admonition
and he who wishes, may keep Allah in mind and imprint in his heart His Glorious Quran which conduces to piety and to contrition
A Quran recorded in Books, honoured and highly esteemed
Exalted, absolute and pure honourably deemed
Recorded by Scribes emblematic of trust
Honourable, pious and just
Accursed be man, how he fights against his own good the best he can
From what primordium did Allah create him
From a seed in fluid emitted did He create him and animate, and his dimensions and his life span, his provisions and his lot did He determine, and his intellect did He actuate
Then He guided him to the path of safety and righteousness and his course did He facilitate
Then He occasioned his death and in the grave did He deposit and inanimate
Then when He wills, He shall resurrect him and animate
But no, he never fulfilled what Allah has commanded and ordained
Let man take a look at his food
We poured down rain-water in quantities which stream and flow
Then We split the earth and break up the soil to allow water in and vegetations to grow
Therein We grew edible grain
Grapes and herbage
Olive trees and palm-dates
Gardens of perennial and other purposeful trees
and fruits and fodder
Sustenance for you and for your cattle
Then when the deafening uproarious eventful Event* comes about
Man shall then flee from his own brother
From his mother and his father
and from his wife and his children
For each of them then, there is enough trouble of his own
Some faces will then be beaming
Smiling and rejoicing in all seeming
Other faces will be coated with gloom
A painful depressing darkness they shall assume
These are the wicked infidels who impudently defied admonition
When once the sun is contracted and loses light and becomes dim
The stars emit no light, lose aspect, contribute to cosmic catastrophes and they are no longer in trim
The mountains are put in motion and vanish
The precious pregnant she - camels are forsaken
The wild beasts are thronged
The seas boil and become inundated
The like are consorted with the like, joined in companionship and associated (or the souls embodied)
The entombed - alive female infant is asked
For what guilt was she made to suffer infanticide
And when the records are laid open and are open wide
And when the heaven is erased
And when Hell is blazed
And when Paradise is brought close at hand
Then, every soul becomes fully cognizant of what she brought along of deeds imprinted with wisdom and piety or works imprinted with iniquity and impiety
I swear by the heavenly bodies that recede
The planets which in a retrograde motion do proceed
And by the night when she feels her way and then softly moves away
And by the morn when it draws the breath of relief and heyday
That it -the Quran- is the word of Allah conveyed by a distinguished Messenger Jibril (Gabriel) who is regarded with honour
He is quite powerful and he is endued from the Throne of grace with high esteem
And he is obeyed in the realm and to his trust he is faithfully supreme
Nor is your companion the -Prophet Muhammad- possessed by an evil spirit
For he certainly saw him -the angel Jibril- at the clear horizon
Nor should he be accused of withholding any heavenly or divine knowledge of the unseen
Nor is it -the Quran- the word of an accursed spirit
How could you think this way and where can you turn
This Quran is but a universal message and an admonition of great concern
For him who, among you, wishes to follow the path of rectitude which is the path in the main
But even then you cannot exercise your will unless it be Allah's will; He is the Creator of the worlds
When once the heaven is cleaved asunder
And the planets are scattered
And the seas are overflown and gain advantage on the kingdom of the shore
And the graves are turned upside down and their contents are discharged and ejected
There and then shall every soul become aware of what it did in its early chapter of life and what it did of late
O man! what has enticed you to be audacious and disloyal to Allah, your Creator, the. Most Beneficent
Who created you and proportioned you and gifted you with interdependent systems to make you an organized whole, and in the upright position* He made you efficient
In whatever form He wills, He shapes you; not to mention, complete defective or deficient
No, but you refuse to acknowledge Allah and do not admit the truth of the Day of Judgement
Yet, in point of fact you are watched by guardian angels who do not recede
They are honourable Scribes
Who know and record every deed
The virtuous shall surely be destined to the heavenly bliss
The wicked shall surely be in the fiercely blazing abyss
A fate, they will suffer in Day of Judgement
They shall not be delivered therefrom nor are they given relief
You just do not know what the Day of Judgement is like
Indeed, you just do not know what the Day of Judgement is like
It is the Day when no soul can avail another nor is there a. safe path to strike, for the full command there and then belongs entirely to Allah
Woe are those who fraudulently scant the measure
When they buy from people they insist on a full measure that will not abate
And when they sell to them they fraudulently scant the measure or the weight
Do they not think they will be resurrected
On a great and eventful Day
A Day when all people shall rise and stand before Allah the Creator of the worlds
No, but now the register of the wicked points out to Sijjeen, the dungeon of the deep dark vault
And you just do not know what Sijjeen is like
The Register incorporates all those irrevocably destined to Sijjeen
There and then denounced shall be those who denied the truth and disagreed with reality
Who declared the Day of Judgment to be untrue and not an actuality
No one denies it but a transgressing impudent sinner
Who closes his heart's ears to Our revelation when rendered to him in discourse and says: "Tales fabled by those of old
No, but what deafened their hearts' ears and made them irresponsive was the blight which their hearts acquired through their ill deeds and woeful story
There and then shall they be excluded from the joy of being sensible to their Creator’s light and glory
That is besides suffering the blazing Hell Fire
There and then shall they be told: "This is the truth which you had always denied to satisfy your vain desire
But the Register of the righteous points out to 'Elliyeen elation and glory
You just do not know what 'Elliyeen is like
The Register incorporates all those irrevocably destined to Elliyeen
It is attested to by the angels nearest to Allah (that)
The virtuous shall he in the beatitude of the heavenly bliss
Gracefully seated, they see the wicked but they look at Allah's light and glory
You recognize in their expressive features the radiance of delight and their delightful story
They are served from sealed nectarian containers with drinks most inviting
Drinks that end with a musky flavour, delicious and righting; an inspiring goal for which may compete those whose ambition is the heavenly bliss
It is blended with ingredients taken from a watery source Tasneem; of quality supreme
Which is a spring reserved only for those nearest to Allah
Those who criminally denied Allah used to laugh at those who faithfully believed
When they went by them they winked to each other and treated them with ridicule
And when they returned to their people they returned with a mouth filled with laughter in contempt
When they saw the believers or met with them they said: "These are indeed the erring faction
As if they were sent to watch their action
And so, today, -Day of Judgment- the situation is being reversed; it is the turn of Allah's devotees to laugh at the infidels, scorn them and hold them in disdain
Gracefully seated, the devotees will direct their eyes at Allah's light and glory and be thankful for the favourable gain
Now have the infidels not been requited with what is commensurate with what they did
When once the heaven is split asunder
In obedience to the command of its Creator and in payment of its duty to Him
And when the earth is stretched out
And disgorges its contents and empties itself of the dead
In obedience to the command of its Creator and in payment of its duty to Him; there and then shall people be adjudged
Remember O man, you are arduously labouring and painfully toiling toward your Creator Whom you shall meet in the end
Then he who is given his book bearing his record in his right hand will have no cause to apprehend
His reckoning will be gracefully conducted
And to his people will he go back rejoicing and greatly delighted
But he who is given his book, bearing his record in his left hand from the back
Will wish he could perish
He will suffer the blazes
How vainly did he rejoice among his people before and disregarded the concord of this discord
He emphatically thought he would never return to his Creator, Whom he never recognized nor adored
But in effect Allah, his Creator had kept him in view and was fully aware of his actions
I swear by the glow of light and display of colour in the sky at the close of the day when the sun sets
And by the night when life closes its lids and past events come to memory and the night-eyed can see and the night wanderer wanders about and the soul roves heaven’s realm
And by the moon at full when its entire disk is illuminated thus dispelling the darkness of the night

That you people shall ride from one circumstance to another and from one mode of existence to another and from a state of things, in which events stand disposed at a particular time, to another, and from one world to another; for in the actual system of things man changes, from one condition to another. He is governed by the inherent dominating power by which actions and feelings are determined
What then prevents them -the infidels- from justifying faith as a conviction operative on their character and will
When the Quran is recited to them, they neither open their hearts' ears nor their minds to stand in awe of Allah and bow to the ground in adoration
No, but the infidels inherently deny the truth which they obstinately reject and the path of righteousness they tend to deviate from
Allah is fully cognizant of what they conceal in their hearts and what is forged in their bosoms and He knows that infidelity is their very prevalent inclination
Therefore, tell them O Muhammad to expect a condign punishment

But not those who believed with hearts impressed with the image of religious and spiritual virtues and with deeds imprinted with wisdom and piety; these are destined to a fortune that is elate, and they will be requited with a reward which will not abate
By the heaven that has been furnished with Zodiacal Signs
And by the day of which promise has been made; a promise affording a ground of expectation of judgment to come

And by the witness who will give evidence in relation to matters of fact when an account of one’s life is being rendered at judgement, and by the deeds which had been witnessed and will be the witness of one’s worth
Accursed above all and devoted to perdition shall be those who cut the trench to trench on the liberty of the innocent and enjoyed witnessing their torture, their torment and their agony
Fire was set in the. trench and supplied with fuel to burn those who surrendered themselves to what is dutiful to Allah
The accursed sat around the fire and regaled themselves
They witnessed and enjoyed what they were doing to those who recognized Allah with hearts impressed with the image of religious and spiritual virtues
They took a cruel, vengeance on them for no reason other than their recognition of Allah AL-Aziz (the Almighty) and AL-Hamid (the Worthy of all praise)
Allah to whom belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth; the AL- Shaheed (the Omnipresent who witnesses all things)
Those who persecuted the believers among the men and the women and did not repent, shall have the painful requital in Hell and shall suffer the blazes

But those whose hearts reflect the image of religious and spiritual virtues and their deeds wisdom and piety shall have gardens of surpassing beauty beneath which rivers flow; and such rapturous delight and elation shall triumph those favoured
The blow of Allah your Creator, is hard and strong
It is He Who creates and re-creates all along
He is the Forgiving Who compassionates whom He sees in distress
He is Allah Who occupies the Glorious Throne
Who carries into effect what He will
Did you not hear O Muhammad of the narrative of what had become of the hosts
The forces of Pharaoh and the Tribe of Thamud
Yet the infidels persist in labeling everything as falsehood
Allah hangs on their rear and besets them on all sides
Never you people doubt, for this indeed is a glorious Quran
Derived from the archetypal text which is preserved in heaven's realm
By the heaven and the celestial body which makes a strong impression upon the sense of vision
And you just do not know what the celestial body which makes a strong impression upon the sense of vision is like
It is the penetrant fiery celestial body which strikes to gain admittance into the terrestrial air
That every soul is but protected by a guardian angel who watches over innocence and folly
Let man ponder from what was he created
He was created from fluid that is simply emitted and ejaculated
He -man- issues forth at birth From the space between the bony pelvis and the breast-bone, the course that is normally negotiated
Does this not show that Allah is Omnipotent enough to have him recreated

That is on the Day of Resurrection, when secrets are brought into the open and man’s countenance will reveal, against his will, all he had hoped would be kept secret and will betray him to his fall or to his exultation
This is the Day when no one shall have power, nor find anyone to afford him help nor impede his prostration
By the heaven and what it returns of condensed water vapour as rain and what it reflects of the various kinds of waves
And by the earth which splits to allow plants to grow
That it- the Quran- is an authoritative revelation and a cannon of faith that is conclusive, determinate and decisive
And not the object of ridicule nor is it derisive
They - the infidels - in their effort to misguide people and divert them from Allah's path keep plotting and continue to scheme
And I -Allah- plan an unfailing scheme
And so, overlook their actions O Muhammad and give them respite; their plots will be of no avail, and Allah's purpose shall prevail
Glorify the Name of Allah, your Creator, the Supreme
Who created all beings and made them well proportioned, and kept the creation in equilibrium

Who guided every being to its befitting course and endowed all beings with the impulses determining their direction to a definite end, and He has indicated to man the path of misery and that of happiness and left him to choose his way
Who also brings forth the vegetation
Then He makes it decay and causes its degeneration
We shall make you recite so that you will not forget

Except as Allah will repeal at a later date; He knows what is avowed openly and the open course of action, and He knows what the breasts forge and what they store of thoughts and feelings and all that is suggested secretly to the mind and He knows all that you do out of sight
We shall facilitate your task and lead you to the facile and ready course
And so, exhort. any who is willing to open his heart's ears and favourably responds
The responsive will be he who reveres Allah with bosom filled with reverential awe
And it -the admonition- will be avoided and unwelcomed by the ill- omened, the unfortunate against whom have been denounced curses and woe
Who will suffer in Hell the immense fire
Wherein he does not die nor live or respire
But blessed, indeed, is he who vindicates his own wrongs and is kindly disposed to benevolence
Who calls Allah his Creator, to mind and engages in the act of worship, doing to Him sincere reverence
But you people prefer the life here afore the heavenly b1iss, knowing it is illusive and alluring
While the Hereafter is far better, blissful, infinitely lasting and enduring
This indeed, has been emphasized in the earlier Scriptures
The Scriptures of Ibrahim and Mussa
Have you been informed of the great talk apropos the overwhelming Event
Some faces are then incensed with humiliation
Reflecting the heedless life they spent uselessly, unprofitably and improvidently; and now they look faint and sick with travail and fear
They are entering into Hell, to suffer the intense heat of the blazing Fire
Only to be given to drink from water bubbling in agitation and issuing from a boiling hot spring
And nothing will they feed on but poisonous, noxious, foul thorny shrubs
Which neither nourish nor pacify their hunger pains
There will be other faces radiant with delight
Pleased with doing their endeavour in life lifting to Allah their inward sight
Enjoying the exalted gardens of Bliss
No matter of little value or insignificance will they hear therein, nor will they hear ill - tongues or what is morally evil
Therein is water streaming forth from a delightful spring
Therein are dignified seats covered with embroidered cloth woven in gold and ornamented with brocade
And drinking glasses set at hand
And cushions, ranked in rows, so bedecked and ornate
And rich carpets all round
Do they - the pagan Arabs - not ponder how camels* were created
How the heavens* have been distantly elevated
How the mountains* which stabilize the earth have been firmly erected
And how the earth has been expanded* and prepared for life thereon
You just continue to exhort the people, for you are here to put them in mind of Allah
And no authority have you over them
But he whose attitude has served to disincline him from doing reverence to Allah and to turn a deaf ear to all He has ordained
Will He requite him with a condign punishment and in Hell will he forever, be detained
Unto Us shall be their return
And then, their judgement will be Our concern
By the dawn and its mystery and what it entails of religious rites
By the ten highly esteemed sacred nights
And by the contrasted yet related, the even and the odd
And by the night when it flows along its way, then it softly moves away
Is there not enough assertion in these corroboratory facts for those who ponder
Did you not see how Allah, Your Creator, dealt with the people of ‘Ad, the Adites; (said to be fifth generation of descendants of Noah)
And with their city of Iram with its lofty and strong architectural pillars imposing, by reason of beauty coupled with magnitude that was indeed grand
The like of which was never created in the land
And how He dealt with the people of Thamud, who hewed out of the huge rocks in the valley outstanding buildings
And how He dealt with Pharaoh who impaled people on the stakes
All of whom practiced tyrannies in the land
They encouraged mischief therein and promoted an age of discord
In consequence did Allah, your Creator, requite them with. painful misfortunes which together with their principles and practice well accord
Allah your Creator is ever vigilant, He pays off the equivalent
When Allah tests man by crediting him with plenty, he immodestly says: "Allah, my Creator, has ministered to my necessities and honoured me with gratification
And when He tests him by restricting his means, he despairingly says: "Allah, my Creator, has disregarded me and reduced me to humiliation
No, but you do not take good care of the orphan to make him feel comfortable and secure
Nor do you encourage benevolence to the indigent who is really poor
You eat greedily all you can get of the inheritance
And you love to hoard wealth inordinately
No, but indeed when the earth will be severely pounded
And there come Allah, your Creator, with His angels ranked in row after row

And then Hell is brought face to face, and there is no escape from the encounter with the infernal hiss and crackle of the flame. Now man remembers his deeds, but how late it is to hope for a better fate
He will wish he had done better in life than what he used to perpetrate
But then no one requites for sins the way Allah does
Nor does anyone bind in captivity the way Allah makes fast with bonds
O you, the untroubled soul
Return to Allah, your Creator, pleased and blessed
Join My devotees
And take up your abode in My Paradise
I swear by this sacred town -Macca
In which you are being an inhabitant, the town which in due time shall open to you its gates and deliver to you O Muhammad its key to accomplish what you will, respected, vindicated and venerated
And I swear by the father –Adam- or –Ibrahim (Abraham)- and what he procreated

That We created man and set him on earth wherein he strives and struggles from womb to tomb, each according to his disposition and inclination and whether he will acknowledge resurrection and adjudication
Does he think no one can overpower him or he will not be called to account
He boastfully says: "I spent too much money", when it was not for a good cause
Does he think no one could see him, not even Allah
Have We not given him a pair of eyes for vision
A tongue and a pair of lips for eating and talking and pronouncing a decision
We showed him both paths, that of virtue and that of vice
Yet he has not been eager to challenge his way through the path of virtue and attempt the difficult path of overcoming self-interest
And you just do not know what the difficult path of overcoming self- interest
It is the freeing of a slave
Or feeding one in need on a day of privation
Such as an orphan of your kin or blood-relation
Or an indigent who is in dire need

Besides being one of those characterized by piety in every deed, who enjoin forbearance under provocation, bear with others their faults and limitations and enjoin endurance of pain, trouble or evil and constancy in labour, exertion or effort and show compassion toward suffering fellow-creatures, being disposed to forgive and exercise mercy
Such persons have rightfully earned the seat on the right
But those who rejected Allah and His authoritative signs and divine revelations are the ill-omened who have deservedly earned the awkward position on the left
Who are destined to be exposed to a perpetual fire in closed cells where there is no escape and of all hope they are bereft
By the sun and its daylight
By the moon which follows it when first seen shortly after their apparent proximity or conjunction
By the day which exposes the sun’s glory and exposes the earth to sight
By the night which keeps the sun out of view and the earth veiled to sight
By the heaven and the way it was constructed
And by the earth and the way its expanse was conducted
And by the soul and how it was made to comprehend the difference between right and wrong and how its contrary attributes were divinely inducted
And how He inspired the self with self-abuse and self-indulgence, as well as with reverence and vindication and self-sacrifice and adaptation
Successful indeed will be he who is endowed with the attribute of self- reproach and self-judgment, who listens to such advice as Allah propounds
And a loser indeed will be he who has perverted himself and by the hand of sin he is bound
The people of Thamud rejected the truth, brought to them by Allah's Messenger - Saleh -, through impudent transgression
And there, did their most wicked leader jump at the occasion to defy Allah's ordinance and prompt the aggression
Allah's Messenger warned them against harming Allah's She- Camel and advised them to let her drink

But they considered him a liar; they disabled the She-Camel by cutting her hamstring muscles; and so Allah pounded them away in requital of their criminal deed, and of all hopes they were dashed to the ground
For Allah fears no consequences nor to anything ever He is bound
By the night when its shades of darkness serve as a veil
And by the day-light and the illumination that emanates from it and does prevail
And by the creation of the, male and the female

That your endeavour you people to attain your goals is diverse; to some, righteousness is but a goal to their will, others in vanity they waste their days, others compromise between opposite motives and exercise adjustment of rival courses of action, and others attain it through benefaction
So that he who gives gratuitously and fears Allah indeed
And solemnly believes in deeds imprinted with wisdom and piety and that the\ end crowns the deed
We will facilitate his task and lead him to the facile and ready course
But he ho is niggardly thinking he is self-sufficient and exercises greed
Denying the Day of Judgment and the requital that is commensurate with one’s deed
We will allow his course to what is miserable, unfavourable and bad
Nor will his material advantages save him from the infernal abode which is dark, troublesome and sad
It is We who indicate to the people what is right and what is wrong
And to Us indeed do the beginning and the end belong, for, one’s own self and all his possessions are not truly his own, but Ours
Therefore I have warned you people of a fiercely blazing fire
No one suffers it but the unfortunate who obstinately denies the truth and to arrogance does he aspire
Who whole heartedly denies Allah and deviates from the path of righteousness and piety
But saved from it will be the one who entertains the profound reverence dutiful to Allah and carries his reverence to Allah from contemplation to reality
Who spends of his wealth in benefaction
With no obligation to any, or expectation of a reward or a favour in return or a mundane satisfaction

But only on account of his interest, to please Allah, his Creator – the Supreme -, and to gain His welcome into His realm and be held precious in His esteem; a welcome featured by the illumination proceeding from Him and by the language spoken by His countenance
Such a person shall be rewarded to his satisfaction
By the forenoon
And by the night when life is reduced to quietness and darkness prevails and falls into a swoon
Allah your Creator, has not forsaken you nor does He dislike you or with you He is displeased
Indeed what awaits you in the Hereafter far excels all that you will experience here with all the gratification and happiness to be occasioned by future victory and satisfaction
And Allah, your Creator, shall bestow on you gratuitously what will meet with your expectation of blessing and benefaction
Did He not find you an orphan and He gave you shelter and care through your kinsman
Did He not find you unsettled and not freed from doubt and uncertainty and He guided you to the path of righteousness and filled your breast with reverential bliss
And did He not find you needy and He made you independent
Therefore, do not mistreat the orphan or humiliate
Nor be unkind to the one who addresses a petition to you, be it for
And express your gratitude by announcing Allah's bounty upon you and all grace abounding in you
Did We not solace you O Muhammad and make joyful your bosom (and make your spirit thirsty for knowledge, wisdom and spiritual light)
